Package org.wildfly.security.credential.source

Class OAuth2CredentialSource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wildfly.security.credential.source.OAuth2CredentialSource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CredentialSource
    @Deprecated
public class OAuth2CredentialSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements CredentialSource
    Deprecated.
    A CredentialSource capable of authenticating against a OAuth2 compliant authorization server and obtaining access tokens in form of a BearerTokenCredential.
    Author:
    Pedro Igor

    • Constructor Detail

      • OAuth2CredentialSource

        private OAuth2CredentialSource​(java.net.URL tokenEndpointUrl,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String>> authenticationHandler,
                               java.lang.String scopes,
                               java.util.function.Supplier<javax.net.ssl.SSLContext> sslContextSupplier,
                               java.util.function.Supplier<javax.net.ssl.HostnameVerifier> hostnameVerifierSupplier)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new instance.
        Parameters:
        tokenEndpointUrl - the OAuth2 Token Endpoint URL
        authenticationHandler - a callback that can be used to push addition parameters to requests sent to the authorization server
        scopes - a string with the scope of the access request
        sslContextSupplier - a supplier from where the SSLContext is obtained in case the token endpoint is using TLS/HTTPS
        hostnameVerifierSupplier - a supplier from where the HostnameVerifier is obtained in case the token endpoint is using TLS/HTTPS

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static OAuth2CredentialSource.Builder builder​(java.net.URL tokenEndpointUrl)
        Deprecated.
        Creates a new OAuth2CredentialSource.Builder instance in order to configure and build a OAuth2CredentialSource.
        Parameters:
        tokenEndpointUrl - the token endpoint that will be used to obtain OAuth2 access tokens
        Returns:
        a new builder instance

      • getCredentialAcquireSupport

        public SupportLevel getCredentialAcquireSupport​(java.lang.Class<? extends Credential> credentialType,
                                                java.lang.String algorithmName,
                                                java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec parameterSpec)
                                         throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: CredentialSource
        Determine whether a given credential is definitely obtainable, possibly obtainable, or definitely not obtainable.
        Specified by:
        getCredentialAcquireSupport in interface CredentialSource
        Parameters:
        credentialType - the credential type class (must not be null)
        algorithmName - the algorithm name, or null if any algorithm is acceptable or the credential type does not support algorithm names
        parameterSpec - the algorithm parameters to match, or null if any parameters are acceptable or the credential type does not support algorithm parameters
        Returns:
        the level of support for this credential type (not null)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the credential source failed to determine the support level

      • getCredential

        public <C extends Credential> C getCredential​(java.lang.Class<C> credentialType,
                                              java.lang.String algorithmName,
                                              java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec parameterSpec)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Deprecated.
        Description copied from interface: CredentialSource
        Acquire a credential of the given type. The credential type is defined by its Class and an optional algorithmName. If the algorithm name is not given, then the query is performed for any algorithm of the given type.
        Specified by:
        getCredential in interface CredentialSource
        Type Parameters:
        C - the credential type
        Parameters:
        credentialType - the credential type class (must not be null)
        algorithmName - the algorithm name, or null if any algorithm is acceptable or the credential type does not support algorithm names
        parameterSpec - the algorithm parameters to match, or null if any parameters are acceptable or the credential type does not support algorithm parameters
        Returns:
        the credential, or null if the principal has no credential of that type
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the realm is not able to handle requests for any reason
